drinkName.name: Bloody Mason

Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake 3 or 4 times and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass.
Garnish with cocktail onions, a spicy pickled green bean, a celery stalk, a pickled okra pod, a crispy strip of bacon and a beef straw.

drinkName.name: Apple Toddy
drinkName.about: Childhood memories of apple cider with a little something extra to remind you why being an adult is OK, too.

mix.how: Fortunately, the labor-intensive part of this drink lies solely in baking the apples.
Take half as many Macintosh apples as you'd like to make drinks, core them, peel them and wrap them in wet parchment paper.
Bake them in a 350-degree oven for 30 to 45 minutes until completely soft.
Set aside until cool.
For each drink, warm a heatproof mug by rinsing it with boiling water.
Put in half a baked apple and a heaping teaspoon of sugar and muddle them quickly together.
Add 1 ounce of boiling water and stir.
Add the applejack, cognac or bourbon and stir again.
Add 1 ounce of boiling water.
(The staggered addition of the water keeps the drink as hot as possible).
Grate nutmeg over the top and serve.

drinkName.name: Corpse Reviver No. 1
drinkName.about: This old-timey cognac drink is a classic cocktail for hair-of-the-dog hangover relief. The Corpse Reviver family of cocktails was traditionally consumed as hair-of-the-dog hangover relievers, meant to refresh after a night of heavy drinking. Revivers were popular during the late 19th and early 20th century, but faded away after Prohibition. Unlike its brother, the No. 2, the Corpse Reviver No. 1 has a rich mixture of spirits with a strong Cognac base.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.

mix.how: Add the water, brandy, orange peel, vanilla extract, ginger and spices a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for one minute, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
Strain out the cloves and orange peel and decant into a serving vessel, leaving behind as much of the other spices as possible.

ingredients.ingredient: Pineapple, peeled, cored and cut into half-inch rings

mix.how: Combine the whiskey, rum, lemon and pineapple in a punch bowl and let stand for at least 3 hours (overnight is best).

Add the rye, lemon juice, maple syrup and egg white to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.
Top with the beer and bitters, and garnish with a piece of beef jerky.

drinkName.name: Death in the Afternoon
drinkName.about: Champion drinker Ernest Hemingway claimed to have invented the Death in the Afternoon, a risky pairing of absinthe and Champagne, himself. His exact instructions suggested adding iced Champagne to a jigger of absinthe until it attained “the proper opalescent milkiness,” then proceeding to drink three to five of the cocktails in one sitting.

mix.how: Pour the absinthe into a coupe glass.
Top with the Champagne.

drinkName.name: The Improved Holland Gin Cock-Tail
drinkName.about: The Improved Holland Gin Cock-Tail is an old-school recipe from mixology legend Jerry Thomas.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich simple syrup (2 parts sugar, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with large, hard, cold ice cubes.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Citrus Thaipiroshka
drinkName.about: Thai basil adds an irreplaceable accent to this vodka-and-ginger-ale concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: Lime wedges, cut in half (4 small pieces)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lime and sugar.
Add the vodka, syrup and lemon juice, and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and pour (unstrained) into a Collins glass.
Add a bit more ice and top with 1 to 1.5 oz of ginger ale.
Stir, and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Tegroni
drinkName.about: Love the Negroni? Try its south-of-the-border tequila cousin.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Rob Roy
drinkName.about: Celebrate the Scottish folk hero with the classic whisky-based Rob Roy cocktail. This recipe is similar to the beloved Manhattan, but uses Scotch instead of rye whiskey and orange bitters instead of aromatic bitters. The difference is delicious—try it for yourself.

ingredients.ingredient:
Scotch
Try it with Chivas Regal

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass over ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with 2 speared brandied cherries.

drinkName.name: Two-Hit Fig Punch
drinkName.about: Whiskey and spiced rum spike this fresh-fruit punch.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a small bowl, muddle the figs well and add the simple syrup.
Place a large block of ice in a punch bowl and add the fig mixture and the remaining ingredients.
Garnish with thinly cut lime wheels and freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Rodriguez Sour
drinkName.about: Fiery jalapeño syrup kicks up this sweet and fruity tequila cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a long slice of jalapeño.

drinkName.name: Oh Gosh
drinkName.about: You’ll be saying “oh gosh” after you taste Tony Conigliaro’s extra-citrusy version of the Daiquiri.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake hard and double-strain into a large, chilled coupette.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Strawberry Basil Lemonade
drinkName.about: What’s not to love about this fresh and fruity gin tipple?

mix.how: In a double Old Fashioned glass, muddle the strawberry and basil leaves in a double Old Fashioned glass.
Fill with ice and set aside.
Add the gin and lemonade into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Top with a splash of club soda.
Garnish with a strawberry slice and basil leaf.

drinkName.name: La Valencia
drinkName.about: Mix tea with more than just hot water. Try this chamomile infused whiskey cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe.

drinkName.name: Uncle Buck
drinkName.about: This is one relative you’ll actually want to spend a lot of time with.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Lucid Frappe
drinkName.about: Expand your mind with this absinthe cocktail.

mix.how: Muddle the mint leaves in the bottom of a frappe style glass.
Add the absinthe, simple syrup and fill with crushed ice.
Pour the mixture into a shaker and shake vigorously.
Pour the contents back into the glass.

drinkName.name: Ward Eight
drinkName.about: The Ward Eight, a turn-of-the-20th-century concoction, is one of Boston’s major contributions to mixology.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with 2 speared cherries.

drinkName.name: London Light
drinkName.about: The subtle botanicals in gin pair well with the fruit juices in this easy-to-make tipple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Strawberry Crush
drinkName.about: Forget crush, this has turned into a full-blown love affair.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberries, mint, lime juice and simple syrup to a juicy pulp.
Pour (unstrained) into a tall Collins glass.
Fill with crushed ice and top with ginger beer.
Garnish with an additional strawberry and mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Brian Boru
drinkName.about: Appreciate vodka in a whole new light with this complex cherry-lemon-tea concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Classic Rum-Brandy Punch
drinkName.about: This historic summer punch brings back the good ol’ days.

mix.how: In a 1-gallon punch bowl, muddle the lemon peels with the sugar and let stand for 3 or 4 hours.
Add the lemon juice and stir until the sugar dissolves.
Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine.
Slide in a 1-quart block of ice and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Ladle into punch cups in 3-ounce portions.
(This recipe makes about 30 servings).

drinkName.name: Frohito
drinkName.about: Throw a classic Mojito in the blender to get this frozen tropical concoction.

mix.how: Add .25 ounce of the Mint Syrup to each of two chilled cocktail glasses and set aside.
Add the rum, lime juice and ice to a blender and blend until a uniform frappé consistency.
Divide the mixture evenly between the two glasses and top each with an additional .25 ounce of the Mint Syrup.
Garnish each glass with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Gin Fizz
drinkName.about: Love the Tom Collins? Try its frothy, bubbly cousin, the Gin Fizz. The secret to creating the perfect creaminess and froth is to shake, shake, shake—and then shake some more.

mix.how: Add the first four ingredients to a shaker and dry-shake (without ice) for about 10 seconds.
Add 3 or 4 ice cubes and shake very well.
Double-strain into a chilled fizz glass and top with club soda.

drinkName.name: Kilbeggan Waterwheel
drinkName.about: Irish whiskey puts on its summer wardrobe in this fruity tipple.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blueberries and sugar.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake well and double-strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with blueberries on a cocktail pick.

drinkName.name: Hard Water Presbyterian
drinkName.about: A slightly spicier version of the classic Presbyterian, this bourbon drink has a real ginger kick.

mix.how: Fill a Collins glass with ice, add the club soda and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake briefly and double-strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a piece of candied ginger.
